title: Accepting Nazirite vows during mourning
vignette: A man mourning a relative impulsively vows to become a nazir.

options.text: He should wait until after mourning to begin.
Start immediately despite grief.

title: Parent's pledge for a minor
vignette: A mother vows her young son will observe Nazirite restrictions for a month.

options.text: Allow it if the child can comply.
Cancel the vow as too burdensome.

title: Accidental impurity from a funeral
vignette: A nazir unexpectedly enters a room with a corpse while paying respects.

options.text: Restart the count after purification.
Continue the count since it was accidental.

title: Drinking wine for medical reasons
vignette: A nazir is prescribed a small amount of wine to aid digestion.

options.text: Permit the wine for health.
Refuse and seek alternative remedies.

title: Shaving mid-term for work
vignette: An employed nazir is required to appear clean-shaven for his job.

options.text: Allow a discreet trim to keep employment.
Maintain the ban on shaving.

title: Long hair causing discomfort
vignette: Near the end of her nazir period, a woman's hair becomes painful and tangled.

options.text: Permit minimal grooming to relieve pain.
Endure until the vow finishes.

title: Pledge without intention
vignette: Someone casually says "I'll be a nazir like Moses" without meaning it seriously.

options.text: Treat it as a binding vow.
Ignore it as a figure of speech.

title: Donation using Nazirite funds
vignette: Money set aside for Nazirite offerings is needed for emergency charity.

options.text: Use it for charity and replace later.
Keep it strictly for the offerings.

title: Nazir assisting with burial
vignette: A community lacks help to bury a stranger. A local nazir is available.

options.text: Allow him to help despite impurity.
He must stay pure and decline.

title: Haircut ceremony delayed
vignette: A nazir completes her vow but there is no Temple access to offer sacrifices.

options.text: Wait until offerings are possible to cut hair.
Cut hair anyway and offer later.

title: Breaking vow due to peer pressure
vignette: Friends tease a nazir at a party until he drinks wine.

options.text: He must restart the vow with a sacrifice.
Overlook it and continue from where he left off.

title: Taking on multiple Nazirite terms
vignette: An enthusiastic youth vows consecutive Naziriteships one after another.

options.text: Discourage and limit to one period.
Permit all the vowed terms.

title: Using hair for charity
vignette: After finishing his vow, a nazir wants to sell his cut hair to donate proceeds.

options.text: Allow the sale and donate the money.
Burn the hair as usual without profit.

title: Nazir traveling overseas
vignette: Travel restrictions abroad make avoiding wine difficult during business trips.

options.text: Delay travel until the vow ends.
Travel anyway and hope to avoid wine.

title: Parents regret child's Nazirite vow
vignette: A boy completes a Nazirite period, but his parents regret encouraging it.

options.text: Do not encourage another term.
Urge him to repeat the Nazirite commitment.
